text:
Some believe the relationship between efforts and results is not linear.  

Scientists call this a “power law.”  

According to the power law theory, some efforts yield much greater results.  

Certain efforts produce exponentially more results than others.  

For example, Nathan Myhrvold, a former Microsoft officer, has said this.  

He confirmed it to me in person.  

He said the top software developers are much more productive.  

They are not more productive by a small amount.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Certain efforts yield disproportionately greater results, highlighting the importance of focusing on what truly matters.
